blog.name: trishasaddictions
blog.title: Blog of a Fangirl
blog.description: 22. Bookworm. TV lover. Movie buff. Music fan. Video Game player. Shipper of many ships.

body:
Starks endgame and direwolves

I have been thinking about this a lot and how I see and want to see it ending. There have been a lot of speculation on how and if the direwolves play a role. And my kind of recent theory doesn’t involve who lives or dies, but who remains a Stark at the very end. Talking about the show, not books. Sansa and Bran no longer have their wolves while Jon does and Arya’s is still alive. So what if it’s foreshadowing? Bran is 3 eye raven now and you could debate not really a Stark anymore. Could that mean Sansa marries someone in the final season? Someone who isn’t a Stark? Maybe Arya goes off to explore and live the life she wants to live, but remains close to her pack? That would leave Jon. Maybe he remains a Stark in the North, possibly not in name but that would be great too. He’s always been a Stark to me and I feel like that is still part of how he identifies.

I could be reaching, but it’s just something that came into my head a couple of nights ago

summary: Thrones Cast Appreciation | day thirteen - most powerful/impressive acting moment in Game of Thrones “Thematically, it...
caption:
Thrones Cast Appreciation | day thirteen - most powerful/impressive acting moment in Game of Thrones

“Thematically, it represented a rebirth. We actually shot a little section where he just gives up, the light disappears above him and for 30 seconds he’s in darkness and he closes his eyes, then something sparks and he starts to fight back.” ~ Miguel Sapochnik

summary: another great...great...great symbol  Jon said to Sansa  if he doesn't protect her his father never forgive him. Sansa is his...
caption:
another great…great…great symbol 

Jon said to Sansa 

if he doesn’t protect her his father never forgive him. Sansa is his duty, because of Ned

Aemon: Love is a Death of Duty

Love is Dany

with Aemon’s word: Love is a Death of Duty=Dany is a death of Sansa


absolutely …absolutely genial …

Cersei to Sansa 


‘’Sansa, permit me to share a bit of womanly wisdom with you on this very special day. 


Love is poison. A sweet poison, yes, but it will kill you all the same’’


Love is a Dany , bt not only Love 

“The light of the half- moon turned Vals honey-blond hair a pale silver and left her cheeks as white as snow. She took a deep breath. The air tastes sweet.”


sweet poison is Dany too

summary: To be fair, Jon would've been a threat to Elia's son and she would probably think of him as such, just like Catelyn did....
question: To be fair, Jon would've been a threat to Elia's son and she would probably think of him as such, just like Catelyn did. Westeros came out of decades of war because some bastard thought he should have his half-brother's birthrights. I think every mother would coldly deal with her husband's bastard son because Daemon is still a trauma over the whole continent... Elia would be no different.
answer: Honestly there’s no guarantee that treating Jon like a son would stop him from stealing Aegon’s inheritance. Jon’s situation isn’t like Edric Storms because Aegon unlike Joffrey is half Dornish. People unfairly mistrust Dornish people a lot. Not many would be happy with a half Dornish king no matter how great Aegon proves himself to be. While I don’t think Elia would be cruel (people wouldn’t sympathise with her the way they would Catelyn), I do think she’d be distant and keep a very close eye on Jon.

body:
From Russia, with love 🇷🇺❤️😂

Found in St. Petersburg. Still regret not spending 45€ on it. The hubs and I laughed so hard we cried! 😂😂😂

Also, I’m back!!! Slowly catching up— what’d I miss?

and why haven’t you given me the reunion i deserve???
a song of ice and fire
summary: i swear, my heart always breaks when i think about the fact that, growing up, Jon always wanted to know what his mother looked...
body:
i swear, my heart always breaks when i think about the fact that, growing up, Jon always wanted to know what his mother looked like, how she was like, and whether or not she loved him

and growing up, he had Arya, who we are shown has a striking resemblance to Lyanna, shares a lot of her character traits, and loves Jon just as fiercely as Lyanna did

summary:
Til Death Do Us Part... - Life with Robb 3 (on Wattpad) https://my.w.tt/lNXh5c8ceQ

Ilva the Winter had always imagined her...
caption:
Til Death Do Us Part… - Life with Robb 3 (on Wattpad) https://my.w.tt/lNXh5c8ceQ Ilva the Winter had always imagined her wedding day to be the most beautiful day of her life. And even though she loves Jon Snow more than anything else in the world, she can’t help missing the man she had planned this wedding with. But Robb Stark died on a battlefield far away from home and Ilva can only hope that he’s proud of her now. Ilva can only hope that he’s proud of her and Jon now. *A modern Game of Thrones fanfiction with a female OC describing the wedding day and Ilva’s life with Robb and with Jon*

I realized I had like 10 unposted chapters of this story. So…let’s see if I can get back into the swing of this again!

summary: I still find it so weird that people used Jon getting mad at Theon as evidence that Jon wants Sansa. The man was mad because.....
body: I still find it so weird that people used Jon getting mad at Theon as evidence that Jon wants Sansa. The man was mad because.. hello.. Robb. And the betrayal against their family. What saved Theon from Jon using violence was that he had helped Sansa. But it was still thrown into a category of Jon getting mad at guys because of jealousy over Sansa or some shit.

reblog.comment: I still find it so weird that people used Jon getting mad at Theon as evidence that Jon wants Sansa. The man was mad because.. hello.. Robb. And the betrayal against their family. What saved Theon from Jon using violence was that he had helped Sansa. But it was still thrown into a category of Jon getting mad at guys because of jealousy over Sansa or some shit.
